0.name: Maize
0.description: A widely cultivated cereal crop known for its kernels used as food and animal feed.

1.name: Sugar beet
1.description: A root crop used for sugar production and livestock feed.

2.name: Soy
2.description: A legume rich in protein, commonly used in food, oil, and animal feed.

3.name: Sunflower
3.description: A tall crop grown for its seeds and oil with bright yellow flowers.

4.name: Potato
4.description: A tuber crop widely used as a staple food, rich in starch.

5.name: Pea
5.description: A legume producing edible green seeds often consumed fresh or dried.

6.name: Bean
6.description: A leguminous plant with edible seeds, rich in protein and fiber.

7.name: Pumpkin
7.description: A fruit crop used in cooking and baking, also grown for livestock feed.

8.name: Grasses
8.description: Monocotyledonous plants that include pasture and forage species.

9.name: Amaranth
9.description: A fast-growing weed or pseudo-cereal crop, often invasive in fields.

10.name: Goosefoot
10.description: A broadleaf weed that competes with crops for light and nutrients.

11.name: Knotweed
11.description: A persistent and invasive weed, difficult to control in crop systems.

12.name: Corn spurry
12.description: A small-seeded weed found in cereal fields, reducing crop yields.

13.name: Chickweed
13.description: A soft-stemmed weed found in cultivated fields and gardens.

14.name: Solanales
14.description: A plant order including nightshades and weedy species like black nightshade.

15.name: Potato weed
15.description: A common weed species found in potato and vegetable crops.

16.name: Chamomile
16.description: An aromatic plant, sometimes a weed in cereal crops.

17.name: Thistle
17.description: A spiny weed that aggressively competes with crops and reduces yields.

18.name: Mercuries
18.description: A group of broadleaf weeds toxic to livestock and troublesome in crops.

19.name: Geranium
19.description: A flowering plant species; some types act as crop-invading weeds.

20.name: Crucifer
20.description: Includes mustard-family weeds like wild radish; competes with crops.

21.name: Poppy
21.description: A weed with bright flowers, often found in cereal and legume fields.

22.name: Plantago
22.description: A ground-hugging weed that competes with crops in low-growing systems.

23.name: Labiate
23.description: A family of aromatic herbs; some species act as competitive weeds.
